section: ff.h lib/pico-vfs-REGI-Local/vendor/ff15/source/ff.h Go to the documentation of this file.00001 /*----------------------------------------------------------------------------/ 00002 / FatFs - Generic FAT Filesystem module R0.15 / 00003 /-----------------------------------------------------------------------------/ 00004 / 00005 / Copyright (C) 2022, ChaN, all right reserved. 00006 / 00007 / FatFs module is an open source software. Redistribution and use of FatFs in 00008 / source and binary forms, with or without modification, are permitted provided 00009 / that the following condition is met: 00010 00011 / 1. Redistributions of source code must retain the above copyright notice, 00012 / this condition and the following disclaimer. 00013 / 00014 / This software is provided by the copyright holder and contributors "AS IS" 00015 / and any warranties related to this software are DISCLAIMED. 00016 / The copyright owner or contributors be NOT LIABLE for any damages caused 00017 / by use of this software. 00018 / 00019 /----------------------------------------------------------------------------*/ 00020 00021 00022 #ifndef FF_DEFINED 00023 #define FF_DEFINED 80286 /* Revision ID */ 00024 00025 #ifdef __cplusplus 00026 extern "C" { 00027 #endif 00028 00029 #include "ffconf.h" /* FatFs configuration options */ 00030 00031 #if FF_DEFINED != FFCONF_DEF 00032 #error Wrong configuration file (ffconf.h). 00033 #endif 00034 00035 00036 /* Integer types used for FatFs API */ 00037 00038 #if defined(_WIN32) /* Windows VC++ (for development only) */ 00039 #define FF_INTDEF 2 00040 #include <windows.h> 00041 typedef unsigned __int64 QWORD; 00042 #include <float.h> 00043 #define isnan(v) _isnan(v) 00044 #define isinf(v) (!_finite(v)) 00045 00046 #elif (defined(__STDC_VERSION__) && __STDC_VERSION__ >= 199901L) || defined(__cplusplus) /* C99 or later */ 00047 #define FF_INTDEF 2 00048 #include <stdint.h> 00049 typedef unsigned int UINT; /* int must be 16-bit or 32-bit */ 00050 typedef unsigned char BYTE; /* char must be 8-bit */ 00051 typedef uint16_t WORD; /* 16-bit unsigned integer */ 00052 typedef uint32_t DWORD; /* 32-bit unsigned integer */ 00053 typedef uint64_t QWORD; /* 64-bit unsigned integer */ 00054 typedef WORD WCHAR; /* UTF-16 character type */ 00055 00056 #else /* Earlier than C99 */ 00057 #define FF_INTDEF 1 00058 typedef unsigned int UINT; /* int must be 16-bit or 32-bit */ 00059 typedef unsigned char BYTE; /* char must be 8-bit */ 00060 typedef unsigned short WORD; /* 16-bit unsigned integer */ 00061 typedef unsigned long DWORD; /* 32-bit unsigned integer */ 00062 typedef WORD WCHAR; /* UTF-16 character type */ 00063 #endif 00064 00065 00066 /* Type of file size and LBA variables */ 00067 00068 #if FF_FS_EXFAT 00069 #if FF_INTDEF != 2 00070 #error exFAT feature wants C99 or later 00071 #endif 00072 typedef QWORD FSIZE_t; 00073 #if FF_LBA64 00074 typedef QWORD LBA_t; 00075 #else 00076 typedef DWORD LBA_t; 00077 #endif 00078 #else 00079 #if FF_LBA64 00080 #error exFAT needs to be enabled when enable 64-bit LBA 00081 #endif 00082 typedef DWORD FSIZE_t; 00083 typedef DWORD LBA_t; 00084 #endif 00085 00086 00087 00088 /* Type of path name strings on FatFs API (TCHAR) */ 00089 00090 #if FF_USE_LFN && FF_LFN_UNICODE == 1 /* Unicode in UTF-16 encoding */ 00091 typedef WCHAR TCHAR; 00092 #define _T(x) L ## x 00093 #define _TEXT(x) L ## x 00094 #elif FF_USE_LFN && FF_LFN_UNICODE == 2 /* Unicode in UTF-8 encoding */ 00095 typedef char TCHAR; 00096 #define _T(x) u8 ## x 00097 #define _TEXT(x) u8 ## x 00098 #elif FF_USE_LFN && FF_LFN_UNICODE == 3 /* Unicode in UTF-32 encoding */ 00099 typedef DWORD TCHAR; 00100 #define _T(x) U ## x 00101 #define _TEXT(x) U ## x 00102 #elif FF_USE_LFN && (FF_LFN_UNICODE < 0 || FF_LFN_UNICODE > 3) 00103 #error Wrong FF_LFN_UNICODE setting 00104 #else /* ANSI/OEM code in SBCS/DBCS */ 00105 typedef char TCHAR; 00106 #define _T(x) x 00107 #define _TEXT(x) x 00108 #endif 00109 00110 00111 00112 /* Definitions of volume management */ 00113 00114 #if FF_MULTI_PARTITION /* Multiple partition configuration */ 00115 typedef struct { 00116 BYTE pd; /* Physical drive number */ 00117 BYTE pt; /* Partition: 0:Auto detect, 1-4:Forced partition) */ 00118 } PARTITION; 00119 extern PARTITION VolToPart[]; /* Volume - Partition mapping table */ 00120 #endif 00121 00122 #if FF_STR_VOLUME_ID 00123 #ifndef FF_VOLUME_STRS 00124 extern const char* VolumeStr[FF_VOLUMES]; /* User defied volume ID */ 00125 #endif 00126 #endif 00127 00128 00129 00130 /* Filesystem object structure (FATFS) */ 00131 00132 typedef struct { 00133 BYTE fs_type; /* Filesystem type (0:not mounted) */ 00134 BYTE pdrv; /* Volume hosting physical drive */ 00135 BYTE ldrv; /* Logical drive number (used only when FF_FS_REENTRANT) */ 00136 BYTE n_fats; /* Number of FATs (1 or 2) */ 00137 BYTE wflag; /* win[] status (b0:dirty) */ 00138 BYTE fsi_flag; /* FSINFO status (b7:disabled, b0:dirty) */ 00139 WORD id; /* Volume mount ID */ 00140 WORD n_rootdir; /* Number of root directory entries (FAT12/16) */ 00141 WORD csize; /* Cluster size [sectors] */ 00142 #if FF_MAX_SS != FF_MIN_SS 00143 WORD ssize; /* Sector size (512, 1024, 2048 or 4096) */ 00144 #endif 00145 #if FF_USE_LFN 00146 WCHAR* lfnbuf; /* LFN working buffer */ 00147 #endif 00148 #if FF_FS_EXFAT 00149 BYTE* dirbuf; /* Directory entry block scratchpad buffer for exFAT */ 00150 #endif 00151 #if !FF_FS_READONLY 00152 DWORD last_clst; /* Last allocated cluster */ 00153 DWORD free_clst; /* Number of free clusters */ 00154 #endif 00155 #if FF_FS_RPATH 00156 DWORD cdir; /* Current directory start cluster (0:root) */ 00157 #if FF_FS_EXFAT 00158 DWORD cdc_scl; /* Containing directory start cluster (invalid when cdir is 0) */ 00159 DWORD cdc_size; /* b31-b8:Size of containing directory, b7-b0: Chain status */ 00160 DWORD cdc_ofs; /* Offset in the containing directory (invalid when cdir is 0) */ 00161 #endif 00162 #endif 00163 DWORD n_fatent; /* Number of FAT entries (number of clusters + 2) */ 00164 DWORD fsize; /* Number of sectors per FAT */ 00165 LBA_t volbase; /* Volume base sector */ 00166 LBA_t fatbase; /* FAT base sector */ 00167 LBA_t dirbase; /* Root directory base sector (FAT12/16) or cluster (FAT32/exFAT) */ 00168 LBA_t database; /* Data base sector */ 00169 #if FF_FS_EXFAT 00170 LBA_t bitbase; /* Allocation bitmap base sector */ 00171 #endif 00172 LBA_t winsect; /* Current sector appearing in the win[] */ 00173 BYTE win[FF_MAX_SS]; /* Disk access window for Directory, FAT (and file data at tiny cfg) */ 00174 } FATFS; 00175 00176 00177 00178 /* Object ID and allocation information (FFOBJID) */ 00179 00180 typedef struct { 00181 FATFS* fs; /* Pointer to the hosting volume of this object */ 00182 WORD id; /* Hosting volume's mount ID */ 00183 BYTE attr; /* Object attribute */ 00184 BYTE stat; /* Object chain status (b1-0: =0:not contiguous, =2:contiguous, =3:fragmented in this session, b2:sub-directory stretched) */ 00185 DWORD sclust; /* Object data start cluster (0:no cluster or root directory) */ 00186 FSIZE_t objsize; /* Object size (valid when sclust != 0) */ 00187 #if FF_FS_EXFAT 00188 DWORD n_cont; /* Size of first fragment - 1 (valid when stat == 3) */ 00189 DWORD n_frag; /* Size of last fragment needs to be written to FAT (valid when not zero) */ 00190 DWORD c_scl; /* Containing directory start cluster (valid when sclust != 0) */ 00191 DWORD c_size; /* b31-b8:Size of containing directory, b7-b0: Chain status (valid when c_scl != 0) */ 00192 DWORD c_ofs; /* Offset in the containing directory (valid when file object and sclust != 0) */ 00193 #endif 00194 #if FF_FS_LOCK 00195 UINT lockid; /* File lock ID origin from 1 (index of file semaphore table Files[]) */ 00196 #endif 00197 } FFOBJID; 00198 00199 00200 00201 /* File object structure (FIL) */ 00202 00203 typedef struct { 00204 FFOBJID obj; /* Object identifier (must be the 1st member to detect invalid object pointer) */ 00205 BYTE flag; /* File status flags */ 00206 BYTE err; /* Abort flag (error code) */ 00207 FSIZE_t fptr; /* File read/write pointer (Zeroed on file open) */ 00208 DWORD clust; /* Current cluster of fpter (invalid when fptr is 0) */ 00209 LBA_t sect; /* Sector number appearing in buf[] (0:invalid) */ 00210 #if !FF_FS_READONLY 00211 LBA_t dir_sect; /* Sector number containing the directory entry (not used at exFAT) */ 00212 BYTE* dir_ptr; /* Pointer to the directory entry in the win[] (not used at exFAT) */ 00213 #endif 00214 #if FF_USE_FASTSEEK 00215 DWORD* cltbl; /* Pointer to the cluster link map table (nulled on open, set by application) */ 00216 #endif 00217 #if !FF_FS_TINY 00218 BYTE buf[FF_MAX_SS]; /* File private data read/write window */ 00219 #endif 00220 } FIL; 00221 00222 00223 00224 /* Directory object structure (DIR) */ 00225 00226 typedef struct { 00227 FFOBJID obj; /* Object identifier */ 00228 DWORD dptr; /* Current read/write offset */ 00229 DWORD clust; /* Current cluster */ 00230 LBA_t sect; /* Current sector (0:Read operation has terminated) */ 00231 BYTE* dir; /* Pointer to the directory item in the win[] */ 00232 BYTE fn[12]; /* SFN (in/out) {body[8],ext[3],status[1]} */ 00233 #if FF_USE_LFN 00234 DWORD blk_ofs; /* Offset of current entry block being processed (0xFFFFFFFF:Invalid) */ 00235 #endif 00236 #if FF_USE_FIND 00237 const TCHAR* pat; /* Pointer to the name matching pattern */ 00238 #endif 00239 } FATFS_DIR; // Renamed to conflict with standard DIR 00240 00241 00242 00243 /* File information structure (FILINFO) */ 00244 00245 typedef struct { 00246 FSIZE_t fsize; /* File size */ 00247 WORD fdate; /* Modified date */ 00248 WORD ftime; /* Modified time */ 00249 BYTE fattrib; /* File attribute */ 00250 #if FF_USE_LFN 00251 TCHAR altname[FF_SFN_BUF + 1];/* Alternative file name */ 00252 TCHAR fname[FF_LFN_BUF + 1]; /* Primary file name */ 00253 #else 00254 TCHAR fname[12 + 1]; /* File name */ 00255 #endif 00256 } FILINFO; 00257 00258 00259 00260 /* Format parameter structure (MKFS_PARM) */ 00261 00262 typedef struct { 00263 BYTE fmt; /* Format option (FM_FAT, FM_FAT32, FM_EXFAT and FM_SFD) */ 00264 BYTE n_fat; /* Number of FATs */ 00265 UINT align; /* Data area alignment (sector) */ 00266 UINT n_root; /* Number of root directory entries */ 00267 DWORD au_size; /* Cluster size (byte) */ 00268 } MKFS_PARM; 00269 00270 00271 00272 /* File function return code (FRESULT) */ 00273 00274 typedef enum { 00275 FR_OK = 0, /* (0) Succeeded */ 00276 FR_DISK_ERR, /* (1) A hard error occurred in the low level disk I/O layer */ 00277 FR_INT_ERR, /* (2) Assertion failed */ 00278 FR_NOT_READY, /* (3) The physical drive cannot work */ 00279 FR_NO_FILE, /* (4) Could not find the file */ 00280 FR_NO_PATH, /* (5) Could not find the path */ 00281 FR_INVALID_NAME, /* (6) The path name format is invalid */ 00282 FR_DENIED, /* (7) Access denied due to prohibited access or directory full */ 00283 FR_EXIST, /* (8) Access denied due to prohibited access */ 00284 FR_INVALID_OBJECT, /* (9) The file/directory object is invalid */ 00285 FR_WRITE_PROTECTED, /* (10) The physical drive is write protected */ 00286 FR_INVALID_DRIVE, /* (11) The logical drive number is invalid */ 00287 FR_NOT_ENABLED, /* (12) The volume has no work area */ 00288 FR_NO_FILESYSTEM, /* (13) There is no valid FAT volume */ 00289 FR_MKFS_ABORTED, /* (14) The f_mkfs() aborted due to any problem */ 00290 FR_TIMEOUT, /* (15) Could not get a grant to access the volume within defined period */ 00291 FR_LOCKED, /* (16) The operation is rejected according to the file sharing policy */ 00292 FR_NOT_ENOUGH_CORE, /* (17) LFN working buffer could not be allocated */ 00293 FR_TOO_MANY_OPEN_FILES, /* (18) Number of open files > FF_FS_LOCK */ 00294 FR_INVALID_PARAMETER /* (19) Given parameter is invalid */ 00295 } FRESULT; 00296 00297 00298 00299 00300 /*--------------------------------------------------------------*/ 00301 /* FatFs Module Application Interface */ 00302 /*--------------------------------------------------------------*/ 00303 00304 FRESULT f_open (FIL* fp, const TCHAR* path, BYTE mode); /* Open or create a file */ 00305 FRESULT f_close (FIL* fp); /* Close an open file object */ 00306 FRESULT f_read (FIL* fp, void* buff, UINT btr, UINT* br); /* Read data from the file */ 00307 FRESULT f_write (FIL* fp, const void* buff, UINT btw, UINT* bw); /* Write data to the file */ 00308 FRESULT f_lseek (FIL* fp, FSIZE_t ofs); /* Move file pointer of the file object */ 00309 FRESULT f_truncate (FIL* fp); /* Truncate the file */ 00310 FRESULT f_sync (FIL* fp); /* Flush cached data of the writing file */ 00311 FRESULT f_opendir (FATFS_DIR* dp, const TCHAR* path); /* Open a directory */ 00312 FRESULT f_closedir (FATFS_DIR* dp); /* Close an open directory */ 00313 FRESULT f_readdir (FATFS_DIR* dp, FILINFO* fno); /* Read a directory item */ 00314 FRESULT f_findfirst (FATFS_DIR* dp, FILINFO* fno, const TCHAR* path, const TCHAR* pattern); /* Find first file */ 00315 FRESULT f_findnext (FATFS_DIR* dp, FILINFO* fno); /* Find next file */ 00316 FRESULT f_mkdir (const TCHAR* path); /* Create a sub directory */ 00317 FRESULT f_unlink (const TCHAR* path); /* Delete an existing file or directory */ 00318 FRESULT f_rename (const TCHAR* path_old, const TCHAR* path_new); /* Rename/Move a file or directory */ 00319 FRESULT f_stat (const TCHAR* path, FILINFO* fno); /* Get file status */ 00320 FRESULT f_chmod (const TCHAR* path, BYTE attr, BYTE mask); /* Change attribute of a file/dir */ 00321 FRESULT f_utime (const TCHAR* path, const FILINFO* fno); /* Change timestamp of a file/dir */ 00322 FRESULT f_chdir (const TCHAR* path); /* Change current directory */ 00323 FRESULT f_chdrive (const TCHAR* path); /* Change current drive */ 00324 FRESULT f_getcwd (TCHAR* buff, UINT len); /* Get current directory */ 00325 FRESULT f_getfree (const TCHAR* path, DWORD* nclst, FATFS** fatfs); /* Get number of free clusters on the drive */ 00326 FRESULT f_getlabel (const TCHAR* path, TCHAR* label, DWORD* vsn); /* Get volume label */ 00327 FRESULT f_setlabel (const TCHAR* label); /* Set volume label */ 00328 FRESULT f_forward (FIL* fp, UINT(*func)(const BYTE*,UINT), UINT btf, UINT* bf); /* Forward data to the stream */ 00329 FRESULT f_expand (FIL* fp, FSIZE_t fsz, BYTE opt); /* Allocate a contiguous block to the file */ 00330 FRESULT f_mount (FATFS* fs, const TCHAR* path, BYTE opt); /* Mount/Unmount a logical drive */ 00331 FRESULT f_mkfs (const TCHAR* path, const MKFS_PARM* opt, void* work, UINT len); /* Create a FAT volume */ 00332 FRESULT f_fdisk (BYTE pdrv, const LBA_t ptbl[], void* work); /* Divide a physical drive into some partitions */ 00333 FRESULT f_setcp (WORD cp); /* Set current code page */ 00334 int f_putc (TCHAR c, FIL* fp); /* Put a character to the file */ 00335 int f_puts (const TCHAR* str, FIL* cp); /* Put a string to the file */ 00336 int f_printf (FIL* fp, const TCHAR* str, ...); /* Put a formatted string to the file */ 00337 TCHAR* f_gets (TCHAR* buff, int len, FIL* fp); /* Get a string from the file */ 00338 00339 /* Some API fucntions are implemented as macro */ 00340 00341 #define f_eof(fp) ((int)((fp)->fptr == (fp)->obj.objsize)) 00342 #define f_error(fp) ((fp)->err) 00343 #define f_tell(fp) ((fp)->fptr) 00344 #define f_size(fp) ((fp)->obj.objsize) 00345 #define f_rewind(fp) f_lseek((fp), 0) 00346 #define f_rewinddir(dp) f_readdir((dp), 0) 00347 #define f_rmdir(path) f_unlink(path) 00348 #define f_unmount(path) f_mount(0, path, 0) 00349 00350 00351 00352 00353 /*--------------------------------------------------------------*/ 00354 /* Additional Functions */ 00355 /*--------------------------------------------------------------*/ 00356 00357 /* RTC function (provided by user) */ 00358 #if !FF_FS_READONLY && !FF_FS_NORTC 00359 DWORD get_fattime (void); /* Get current time */ 00360 #endif 00361 00362 00363 /* LFN support functions (defined in ffunicode.c) */ 00364 00365 #if FF_USE_LFN >= 1 00366 WCHAR ff_oem2uni (WCHAR oem, WORD cp); /* OEM code to Unicode conversion */ 00367 WCHAR ff_uni2oem (DWORD uni, WORD cp); /* Unicode to OEM code conversion */ 00368 DWORD ff_wtoupper (DWORD uni); /* Unicode upper-case conversion */ 00369 #endif 00370 00371 00372 /* O/S dependent functions (samples available in ffsystem.c) */ 00373 00374 #if FF_USE_LFN == 3 /* Dynamic memory allocation */ 00375 void* ff_memalloc (UINT msize); /* Allocate memory block */ 00376 void ff_memfree (void* mblock); /* Free memory block */ 00377 #endif 00378 #if FF_FS_REENTRANT /* Sync functions */ 00379 int ff_mutex_create (int vol); /* Create a sync object */ 00380 void ff_mutex_delete (int vol); /* Delete a sync object */ 00381 int ff_mutex_take (int vol); /* Lock sync object */ 00382 void ff_mutex_give (int vol); /* Unlock sync object */ 00383 #endif 00384 00385 00386 00387 00388 /*--------------------------------------------------------------*/ 00389 /* Flags and Offset Address */ 00390 /*--------------------------------------------------------------*/ 00391 00392 /* File access mode and open method flags (3rd argument of f_open) */ 00393 #define FA_READ 0x01 00394 #define FA_WRITE 0x02 00395 #define FA_OPEN_EXISTING 0x00 00396 #define FA_CREATE_NEW 0x04 00397 #define FA_CREATE_ALWAYS 0x08 00398 #define FA_OPEN_ALWAYS 0x10 00399 #define FA_OPEN_APPEND 0x30 00400 00401 /* Fast seek controls (2nd argument of f_lseek) */ 00402 #define CREATE_LINKMAP ((FSIZE_t)0 - 1) 00403 00404 /* Format options (2nd argument of f_mkfs) */ 00405 #define FM_FAT 0x01 00406 #define FM_FAT32 0x02 00407 #define FM_EXFAT 0x04 00408 #define FM_ANY 0x07 00409 #define FM_SFD 0x08 00410 00411 /* Filesystem type (FATFS.fs_type) */ 00412 #define FS_FAT12 1 00413 #define FS_FAT16 2 00414 #define FS_FAT32 3 00415 #define FS_EXFAT 4 00416 00417 /* File attribute bits for directory entry (FILINFO.fattrib) */ 00418 #define AM_RDO 0x01 /* Read only */ 00419 #define AM_HID 0x02 /* Hidden */ 00420 #define AM_SYS 0x04 /* System */ 00421 #define AM_DIR 0x10 /* Directory */ 00422 #define AM_ARC 0x20 /* Archive */ 00423 00424 00425 #ifdef __cplusplus 00426 } 00427 #endif 00428 00429 #endif /* FF_DEFINED */
